Java Puzzle #3: Rounding

17 Jul 2012

The puzzle

What is the output of the following script: [java]public class test { public static void main(String[] args) { double x = 0.4999999999999999; double y = 0.49999999999999992; double z = 0.49999999999999994; System.out.println(x + " rounded is " + Math.round(x)); System.out.println(y + " rounded is " + Math.round(y)); System.out.println(z + " rounded is " + Math.round(z)); } }[/java]

. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Answer

[bash]0.4999999999999999 rounded is 0 0.49999999999999994 rounded is 1 0.49999999999999994 rounded is 1[/bash]

Explanation

It's a bug.

See also: Why does Math.round(0.49999999999999994) return 1
